definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
random inspection/to do a spot check
to perform divination with sticks/to draw lots/a ballot (in share dealing)
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
to extract/to remove/to draw (a sales commission, venom from a snake etc)
to find the time to do sth
to get away from/to withdraw/to free oneself

sentences.english: And the pump has a wooden handle to prevent burns to the hands.
sentences.chinese: 而且抽气筒还安有一个木制的把手用来防止手被烫伤。

sentences.english: Tell the boy not to swish the flower heads off with his stick.
sentences.chinese: 告诉那小男孩别用棍子把花朵抽下来。

sentences.english: He's always bumming cigarettes from others.
I mean you can't walk into a restaurant, roll a joint, and start puffin' away.
sentences.chinese: 我是说，你不能叼着大麻走进一家餐馆，然后开始抽。

sentences.english: She stubbed out the cigarette after the first puff.
sentences.chinese: 她只抽了一口香烟就把它掐灭了。

sentences.english: She snuffles, like a hungry horse.
sentences.chinese: 她抽了一下鼻子，就像一匹饥饿的马。

sentences.english: United have been drawn at home to Wolverhampton Wanderers in the third round of the Carling Cup.
sentences.chinese: 曼联在联赛杯第三轮的比赛里抽中了狼队。

sentences.english: It is feasible that both exhaustion and wetting by steam fog are carried out in the chamber with low pressure.
sentences.chinese: 低气压室中既抽真空又用蒸汽雾湿润是可行的。

sentences.english: He has not quit smoking, but is holding down to three cigarettes a day.
sentences.chinese: 他并戒烟，已减到每天只抽三支烟了。

sentences.english: Double zipper design handle on the cover in side pocket.
sentences.chinese: 双拉炼设计，上盖附设手抽，内盖设有透明格仔袋。

sentences.english: I don't have a lighter because I only happen to smoke O. P. B.
sentences.chinese: 我没有打火机，因为我只是偶尔抽他人的香烟。

sentences.english: But for me, this was like 'only having a couple of cigarettes a week.
sentences.chinese: 但这对我来说就像“一星期只抽两根烟”。

sentences.english: It's five-day long since I have got your reply last time.
sentences.chinese: 每次上完课，老师抽一点时间给微凫查我的作业。
这些男孩子正在抽陀螺。

sentences.english: My father allows himself only three cigars a day.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸给自己规定一天只抽三支雪茄烟。

sentences.english: XiaoFei smoke a empty visit queen dugu.
sentences.chinese: 萧妃抽了个空探望独孤皇后。

definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
